Closing Date for Applications is September 19, 2025. Why join our team? Sparwood is situated in the Rocky Mountains of southeastern BC with an array of outdoor recreational opportunities, which include skiing and snowboarding at nearby Fernie Alpine Resort, hiking, snowshoeing, cross-country skiing, stunning vistas, wildlife, and all the fresh elements naturally afforded in a spectacular mountain setting. An Active Living Pass which includes free access to the pool, gym, ice rink, squash, and racquetball courts, climbing wall, and some fitness classes is provided to you so you can take advantage of our recreational facilities during your employment! What you'll be doing: Under the direction of the Information Technology Supervisor, the I.T. Co-op student will work with the IT Team to provide desktop support and troubleshooting hardware and software issues. The IT Co-op Student will install and maintain computer systems and networks aiming for the highest functionality. The role will also focus on assisting with special IT projects. Onboard New Employees • Set up and configure laptops and workstations • Install and configure software and accounts (Office 365, VPN, Adobe, etc.). • Set up and configure desk phones • Set up and configure smartphones (Android/iOS) Provide training on software and systems, along with advice on optimal computer operation and cyber security • Hardware, Software, and Network Support: • Address and resolve incoming tickets from users related to hardware, software, and network issues. • Identify, log, classify, and perform preliminary investigation and diagnosis. Provide timely and effective solutions via phone, email, or in person. • Documentation: Create and/or update documentation for IT systems (User guides, manuals, network maps, etc.). • Special Projects: • Collaborate on technology initiatives that enhance efficiency, security, or user experience. • Contribute to system upgrades, process improvements, or innovative solutions. Work closely with the IT team to implement and evaluate project outcomes. • Salary: The 2025 pay rates under the collective agreement with CUPE Local 2698 are as follows • 1st year of studies completed - $21.71/hr. • 2nd year of studies completed - $23.46/hr. 3rd year of studies completed - $24.64/hr. • Eligibility: This is a formal student co-op program partnership. All applicants must be currently enrolled in Full-Time post- secondary education (at a recognized Canadian academic institution) with participation in a formal cooperative education program. International students must have a valid Canadian work permit. Housing & Relocation: Housing will NOT be provided. Applicants will be responsible for securing temporary accommodation in the Elk Valley Area (Sparwood, Fernie, Elkford, Crowsnest Pass) as part of their employment. The District of Sparwood is happy to support students with a one-time relocation re-imbursement to assist with costs of moving and relocation.
